answers.answer: Im really sorry , i hope you can cheer up i know it must be hard to deal with but i know your strong and you can and will get through this.

Because of a family history of diabetes, I worry that I'll get GD too.  I'm so sorry you have to go thru this, but changing a few things about how and what you eat will benefit both you and your little one!  I'm sure there are a few ladies here who know exactly what you're going thru and can give you lots of advice and support!  Good luck, hon and keep us posted on how things go!*big hugs!!*

it will be ok!!!  I just had my baby on September 10th...I had Gestational Diabetes.  I was diagnosed at like 29 weeks....I did have to test my blood 4 times a day at home..in the morning and after every major meal.  I was nervous and at first I got very depressed but it all turned out ok. I will def. help you with any questions you may have...
Thank you for your kind words girls!  I really appreciate them :)ziggysgrl0724:  How was delivery?  Did your baby gain a lot of weight?  Are you ok now?

well, I had to hve a c-secton because I have had 2 c-sections before....but she was PERFECT...she was 7lbs 13oz, and they had to test her blood sugars after she was born and they were always normal...they said I must have taken very good care of myself.....but I was never put on a structured diet or anything..because when I went to see the specialast he said that based on my blood sugars(I had kept a written a daily log everytime I tested it) that he didnt think I had it that bad...which is unusual....I dont feel that my dr. looked after me the way she should have....as far as me...I still have to get my blood checked to see if it has went away...but I feel good...I am keeping my fingers crossed!!!
sorry for your diagnosis...take care of yourself!
Try to keep strong, yes there are risks with GD but just keep your sugars in control and you AND baby should be fine!

question: Well, after I thought I had passed my 1 hr. glucose test, It turned out I failed.  Saturday went to take the 3 hour (longest 3 hours of my life) and today I was diagnosed with Gest. Diabetes.My Gyn reffered me to a specialist and from waht I've read he will change my eating and excercise habits and I will need to monitor my sugar levels every day.Im so sad...Feeling so down today.Has anyone gone throug this?  If so, how did you manage?
title: I have Gest. Diabetes :( (Need support today)
